707620f-b.title: Manhattan: 1st Ave. - 49th St. E.
707620f-b.text:
(1)
First Ave., east side, north from East 49th Street and Mitchell Plame,, to 50th (Dunscomb Place) Streets. Also shown is Mitchell P1ace, at, ad- ; joining and east of the N.E. corner of First Ave. These buildings will
be demolished, to make way for the Beekman Towers.
September 20, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same after demolition.
October 29, 1927.
P. L. SPerr.

721662f.title: Manhattan: Mitchell Place - 1st Avenue
721662f.text:
7 Vitchell Place (East 49th Street), adjoining the N.E. corner of First Ave., as seen across the clearance at the corner, upon which was constructed the 26-story Pan Hellenic House. Also shown is the west wall of the partially completed Stewart Hall (No. 1O Mitchell Place). This set
consists of a negative and a positive.
October 28, 1927.
F. M. Demarest.
Gift of Albert A. Volk Co.

721663f-a.title: Manhattan: Mitchell Place - 1st Avenue
721663f-a.text:
Mitchell Place, (north side of East 49th Street), north side, east from
and including First Ave., to Beekman Place.
September 20, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.

707621f-a.title: Manhattan: 1st Ave. - 49th St. E.
707621f-a.text:
First Avenue, west side, from East 49th to 50th Streets. The corner row in the center is to be demolished. Views 2 and 3 show this site at various dates. The dominant skyscrapper in the background, is the Rits Tower, an apartment hotel at Park Avenue and
57th Street.
View 1:  October 24, 1928
View 2:  July 3, 1934
View 3:  July 23, 1939
P. L. Sperr
